trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the bababasilisk and the two of them can see each other, the bababasilisk can force the creature to make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw if the bababasilisk isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the bababasilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the bababasilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the bababasilisk sees its reflection within 30 feet of it in bright light, it makes a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or sees itself as a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Bababasilisk makes one bite and one tail attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage, plus 14 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) poison damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 17 ({@damage 5d6 + 5}) poison damage to the target and all creatures in a 5 ft. radius from the target.

monster.name: Baba Lysaga

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Baba Lysaga is a 17th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit +10} to hit with spell attacks). Baba Lysaga has the following {@class wizard} spells prepared:

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: Lysaga can use her action to polymorph into a {@creature swarm of flies|COS-B}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If Lysaga fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Lysaga makes three attacks with her Quarterstaff when cornered

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Summon Insects {@recharge}
entries: Baba Lysaga summons {@dice 1d4} {@creature swarm of flies|COS-B}. A summoned swarm appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of Baba Lysaga and acts as her ally. It remains until it dies or until Baba Lysaga dismisses it as an action.

Two women gave life to Strahd von Zarovich. The first was Queen Ravenovia van Roeyen, Strahd's biological mother. The second was the queen's midwife, a devout follower of Mother Night named Baba Lysaga. Although it was the former who raised Strahd and enabled him to follow in his father's footsteps, it was the latter who sensed a potential for greatness and darkness in Strahd surpassing that of any other mortal. Lysaga believed then, as she believes now, that she is Strahd's true mother.

legendary.name: Flee (1)
entries: Lysaga moves up to her speed while in the Giant Skull. This movement does not incur an attack of opportunity.

legendary.name: Swarm (2)
entries: Lysaga uses her Summon Insects ability, if it is recharged but unused.

legendary.name: Spell (1-3)
entries: Lysaga casts a spell. It costs 1 + the spell's level in Legendary Actions.

legendaryHeader: Lysaga can take 3 legendary actions. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Lysaga regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The thug has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the thug's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thug makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Evil Eye (1/Rest)
entries: This magical ability, which the Vistani call the Evil Eye, duplicates the duration and effect of {@spell animal friendship}, {@spell charm person} , or {@spell hold person} (Thug's choice), but requires neither somatic nor material components. }
The save is {@dc 10}. If the target succeeds on the save, the Vistani Thug is {@condition blinded} until the end of the its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The captain makes three melee attacks: two with its scimitar and one with its dagger. Or the captain makes two ranged attacks with its daggers.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Evil Eye (1/Rest)
entries: This magical ability, which the Vistani call the Evil Eye, duplicates the duration and effect of {@spell animal friendship}, {@spell charm person} , or {@spell hold person} (Bandit's choice), but requires neither somatic nor material components. The save is {@dc 12}. If the target succeeds on the save, the Vistani Bandit is {@condition blinded} until the end of the its next turn.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The captain adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the captain must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.
It takes a strong personality, ruthless cunning, and a silver tongue to keep a gang of bandits in line. The bandit captain has these qualities in spades.

In addition to managing a crew of selfish malcontents, the pirate captain is a variation of the bandit captain, with a ship to protect and command. To keep the crew in line, the captain must mete out rewards and punishment on a regular basis.

More than treasure, a bandit captain or pirate captain craves infamy. A prisoner who appeals to the captain's vanity or ego is more likely to be treated fairly than a prisoner who does not or claims not to know anything of the captain's colorful reputation.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: An animated object doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The hut is {@condition incapacitated} while the magic gem that animates it is in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the hut must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The hut deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hut makes three attacks with its roots. It can replace one of these attacks with a rock attack.

action.name: Root
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 60 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

Baba Lysaga built a hut atop the rotting stump of a giant tree that was felled long ago. It was only after she embedded a magic gemstone in the hut that the whole thing was imbued with a semblance of life. When she wills it to do so, the hut pulls its gigantic roots free of the earth and shambles around like a spidery behemoth, shaking the ground with every step. The hut attacks with its flailing and stomping roots. It can also use its roots to fling large rocks.

entries.name: Hut Interior
entries: The hut is a 15-foot-square, ramshackle wooden building with a gently sloping thatch roof. Its furnishings have been bolted to the floor, since the hut lurches from side to side when it walks.

entries.name: Heart of the Hut
entries: The gemstone that has given life to Baba Lysaga's hut was previously buried in the Wizard of Wines vineyard. The gem was one of three imbued with life-giving magic that made the grapevines in the vineyard healthier, guaranteeing the finest wines. Baba Lysaga stole one of the gems and perverted its magic, using it instead to animate her wooden hut.

Removing the gem from the hut renders the hut incapacitated. That task is easier said than done, however. The glowing green gem is contained in a cavity in the stump, beneath the rotted floorboards of the hut. The floorboards can be ripped up with a successful DC 14 Strength check or smashed by dealing 10 damage to them. Once the floorboards are out of the way, a creature can reach into the cavity and snatch the gem. But if someone attempts this while the hut is alive, the cavity sprouts wooden teeth, becoming a mouth that bites anything that tries to remove the gem; a creature trying to remove the gem must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the creature claims the stone without getting bitten. On a failed save, the creature is bitten for 10 (3d6) piercing damage and fails to obtain the gem.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The witch's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The witch can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Blood Dance
entries: The witch can use a bonus action to control the movement of one creature cursed by its hex spell that it can see within 30 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw or use its reaction to move up to 30 feet in a direction of the witch's choice.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the witch's darkvision.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The witch makes two attacks with its shortsword.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d4 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. The target is {@condition restrained}, ({@dc 16} to escape).
These snakes love to prowl the flooded parts of Berez.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a fly. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

entries.name: The Nature of Swarms
entries: The swarms presented here aren't ordinary or benign assemblies of little creatures. They form as a result of some sinister or unwholesome influence. A vampire can summon swarms of bats and rats from the darkest corners of the night, while the very presence of a mummy lord can cause scarab beetles to boil up from the sand-filled depths of its tomb. A hag might have the power to turn swarms of ravens against her enemies, while a yuan-ti abomination might have swarms of poisonous snakes slithering in its wake. Even druids can't charm these swarms, and their aggressiveness is borderline unnatural.

monster.name: Argynvost's Remains

immune.special: bludgeoning, piercing, & slashing damage from non-magical weapons

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Argynvost's Remains fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Argynvost's Remains can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Cold Breath.
items.entry: The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 58 ({@damage 13d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Draining Breath.
items.entry: The dragon inhales deeply, drawing in air from a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 6d6} necrotic damage, healing Argynvost for one quarter of the total hitpoints. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Disgorge Zombie (1)
entries: Argynvost's Remains vomits up {@dice 1d4} {@creature zombie}s from within it. They act immediately after Argynvost's Remains.

legendary.name: Tail Attack (1)
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Ray of Frost (1)
entries: Argynvost's Shadow shoots a bolt of freezing energy from his mouth, targeting a creature within 60 ft. {@hit 10} to attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d8} cold damage.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (2)
entries: Argynvost's Remains beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or take 15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. It can then fly up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Toll the Dead
entries: Argynvost's Remains lets out a deafening roar, the sound ringing loudly in your ears, targeting a creature within 60 ft. {@{@dc 18}} Wisdom saving throw or take {@dice 3d8} necrotic if at max HP, or {@dice 3d12} if at less than max.

legendaryHeader: Argynvost's Remains can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below, they regain spent legendary actions at the start of its next turn.

monster.name: Strahd von Zaddyvich

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, & slashing from non-magical weapons

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Strahd has access to a variety of spells from various arcane traditions, learned over his extended life. His cantrips are especially potent, dealing half damage even if a creature passes the save. He is considered a 17th Level Spellcaster for the purposes of spell damage. His main spellcasting ability is {@ability Intelligence}, his spells require a save against a {@dc 20} and has a to hit bonus of {@hit 12}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If Strahd fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Action Surge (2/Long Rest)
entries: Strahd can push himself beyond his normal limits for a moment. On his turn, he can take one additional action.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: If Strahd isn't in sunlight or running water, he can use its action to polymorph into a {@creature swarm of bats},a {@creature vampiric mist|mtf|cloud of mist}, a {@creature dire wolf}, or back into his true form.

trait.name: Misty Escape (Vampire)
entries: When he drops to 0 hit points outside his resting place, Strahd transforms into a {@creature vampiric mist|mtf|cloud of mist} (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling {@condition unconscious}, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If he can't transform within the next 2 rounds, he is destroyed.

While he has 0 hit points in mist form, he can't revert to his natural form, and must reach his resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in his resting place, he reverts to his natural form. He is then {@condition paralyzed} until he regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 10 minutes in his resting place with 0 hit points, he regains 1 hit point.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: Strahd can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampiric Regeneration
entries: Strahd regains 25 hit points at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If Strahd takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of Strahd's next turn.

trait.name: Vampire Weakness
entries: {@i Harmed by Running Water & Sunlight}. Strahd takes 15 acid damage if he ends his turn in running water and takes 15 radiant damage if he starts his turn in sunlight. while in sunlight, he has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

{@i Stake to the Heart}. If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into Strahd's heart while Strahd is {@condition incapacitated} in his resting place, Strahd is {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: {@action Dash} | {@action Disengage} | {@action Hide}.

trait.name: Ioun Stone of Concentration (1/Day)
entries: Once per day, Strahd's Ioun Stone of Concentration will concentrate on a spell for him.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Strahd has advantage on saves against spells.

legendary.name: Melee Attack
entries: Strahd takes a single melee attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Strahd moves up to his speed, without taking an attack of opportunity.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (1-4)
entries: Strahd casts a spell, using 1 + Spell Level Legendary actions to do so.

legendaryHeader: Strahd gains 4 legendary actions each time his turn begins.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: Strahd sees an attack incoming, and dodges out of the way, reducing the damage that he takes by half.

reaction.name: Ioun Stones of Absorption & Reserve
entries: A spell of 3rd level of higher that is cast targeting Strahd alone is absorbed by his Ioun stones working in tandem. This burns Strahd's reaction, but grants him an additional spell slot of up to 3rd level to use.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Strahd makes three melee attacks (only one of which can be a bite) or two ranged attacks. He can also use his Charm feature.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d8 + 5} bludgeoning damage, plus {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d6 + 5} piercing damage, plus {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage. A creature's Maximum HP is reduced by the necrotic damage amount and Strahd regains that much HP. Reduction lasts until a long rest or {@spell greater restoration}. A creature drained to 0 HP by the necrotic damage revives as a {@creature vampire spawn} on the next day.

action.name: Vicious Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 9 additional slashing damage on a critical hit.

action.name: Returning Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage. The dagger blinks back into Strahd's hand after striking or missing its target.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: While Strahd is in Castle Ravenloft, he can take lair actions as long as he isn't incapacitated.
On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Strahd can take one of the following lair action options, or forgo using any of them in that round:

items: Until initiative count 20 of the next round, Strahd can pass through solid walls, doors, ceilings, and floors as if they weren't there.

Strahd targets any number of doors and windows that he can see, causing each one to either open or close as he wishes. Closed doors can be magically locked (needing a successful DC 20 Strength check to force open) until Strahd chooses to end the effect, or until Strahd uses this lair action again.

Strahd targets one Medium or smaller creature that casts a shadow. The target's shadow must be visible to Strahd and within 30 feet of him. If the target fails a DC 17 Charisma saving throw, its shadow detaches from it and becomes a {@creature shadow} that obeys Strahd's commands, acting on initiative count 20. A {@spell greater restoration} spell or a {@spell remove curse} spell cast on the target restores its natural shadow, but only if its undead shadow has been destroyed.
Strahd summons some minions from within his castle. {@recharge}. See Below.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Salamancer uses their Charisma to cast, with a {@dc 15} and {@hit 7}.

trait.name: Metamagic (5 / LR)
entries: {@optfeature Twinned Spell} | {@optfeature Distant Spell}

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness (Salaman)
entries: The Salamancer can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Salamander Climb
entries: The Salamancer can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 10/30 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d4 + 4} piercing damage.

action.name: Salamancy {@recharge}
entries: Choose one of the folllowing:

{@i Salamander Breath:} The Salamancer spews a jet of elemental magic in a 5-foot wide, 15-foot long line. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d6} damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The damage type is the Salamancer's choice of acid, cold, fire, or lightning.

{@i Aquatic Camouflage:} While mostly submerged in water, the Salamancer becomes {@condition invisible} as per the {@spell greater invisibility} spell and gains advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks. for up to 1 hour as if concentrating on a spell, or until the Salamancer is no longer mostly submerged. Salamancy can't recharge until this effect ends.

reaction.name: Tail Distratction. (1/Day)
entries: When the Salamancer is reduced to ½ of its maximum hit points, it detaches its tail which begins to writhe distractingly in the air above it in its space. Each creature the Salamancer chooses that can see the tail must succeed on a {@dc 19} WIS save or be {@condition charmed} by the Salamancer for up to 1 minute. A creature {@condition charmed} by this effect is {@condition incapacitated} and can't move, as it is entranced by the hypnotic display. The effect ends for a creature if it takes damage, if it can no longer see the tail, or if another creature uses their action to shake the creature from its stupor.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: When a creature would hit her with a melee weapon attack, and Ireena has a melee weapon in hand, she can add +3 to her AC by bringing her weapon in to parry.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ireena attacks twice, with either her Rapier or her Longbow

action.name: {@item Rapier|phb}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d8 + 3} piercing damage.

action.name: {@item Longbow|phb}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d8 + 3} piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Sir Godfrey is a 13th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Godfrey regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If Godfrey  takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of Godfrey's next turn. Godfrey's body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When Godfrey's body is destroyed, his soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another humanoid corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all his hit points.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: Godfrey is immune to effects that turn undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Godfrey makes two longsword attacks.

action.name: {@item longsword|phb}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 2d8 + 4} slashing damage, or {@damage 2d10 + 4} slashing damage if used with both hands.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Vladimir regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn. If Vladimir takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of Vladimir's next turn. Vladimir's body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: When Vladimir's body is destroyed, his soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another humanoid corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all his hit points.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: Vladimir is immune to effects that turn undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Vladimir makes two attacks with Argynvost's Fang.

action.name: Argynvost's Fang
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@damage 4d8 + 6} slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Dusk Elf Magic
headerEntries: Rahadin's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence. He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components, with {@dc 14} and {@hit 6}:

trait.name: Deathly Choir
entries: Any creature within 10 feet of Rahadin that isn't protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell hears in its mind the screams of the thousands of people Rahadin has killed. As a bonus action, Rahadin can force all creatures that can hear the screams to make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. Each creature takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Rahadin has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put him to sleep.

trait.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: Rahadin can attempt to hide even when he is only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

trait.name: Defender
entries: When Rahadin makes his first moonblade attack of the turn, he can transfer some of the Moonblade's {@hit 3} to hit to his AC instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Rahadin attacks three times with his Moonblade, or twice with his {@condition poisoned} darts.

action.name: Moonblade +0
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Moonblade +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Moonblade +2
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Moonblade +3
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Poisoned Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 1d4 + 6} piercing damage plus {@damage 2d4} poison damage.

Rahadin, the dusk elf chamberlain of Castle Ravenloft, has served Strahd's family faithfully for nearly five hundred years. He is Strahd's eternal servant, a longtime comrade-in-arms, and a ruthless warrior who has killed thousands in his lifetime.

entries.name: Exile
entries: Rahadin was exiled for refusing to bow down to a dusk elf prince whom he considered weak and corrupt. When the dusk elves later declined to pay fealty to King Barov, Rahadin helped Barov conquer them. The elf kingdom's royal line was obliterated, the dusk elves hunted like rabbits. The few that survived were either subjugated or forced to live among the Vistani. So pleased was Barov with Rahadin that the king made the dusk elf an honorary member of his family.

entries.name: Chamberlain
entries: After Barov died, Rahadin continued to fight as one of Strahd's generals. When the wars ended and Strahd turned his attention to building Castle Ravenloft, Rahadin saw to it that wizards and artisans were brought to Barovia. Years later, Strahd appointed Rahadin his castle chamberlain. Rahadin was pleased to do whatever Strahd asked of him, and he instilled terror in the castle staff by routinely flogging those who didn't perform their duties to his exacting standards.

When a dusk elf named Patrina Velikovna came knocking on Strahd's door, Rahadin could see that she intrigued Strahd, but Rahadin was suspicious of her motives. Patrina tried to seduce Strahd with the prospect of immortality - something Strahd desired above all. She told him of a vault of forbidden lore called the Amber Temple, where the secret of gaining immortality was hidden. While Strahd was off exploring the temple, Rahadin handled all of his master's affairs and began searching for a woman who could tear Strahd away from Patrina Velikovna. In this task, he failed. His goal was fulfilled, however, when Sergei, Strahd's brother, found Tatyana.

Tatyana was Strahd's type - a woman of exquisite beauty and gentle manner. When Strahd returned to Ravenloft, the young woman instantly caught his eye, and Rahadin had the pleasure of informing Patrina that her presence at the castle was no longer desired.

Rahadin's loyalty didn't waver after Tatyana died and Strahd became a vampire. Rahadin continued to do his master's bidding. Eager to put Tatyana out of his mind, Strahd lured more women to the castle, taking several of them as brides before draining their lives and turning them into vampire spawn. Rahadin would see to it that these women were lavished with jewels and fine clothes, and made comfortable during their stay in Ravenloft.

entries.name: Executioner
entries: Patrina Velikovna and her people were living among the Vistani when they heard of Tatyana's death and Strahd's curse. The ageless Patrina returned to Ravenloft in the hope of winning Strahd's love. This time, it was clear that Patrina craved Strahd's power and that Strahd would never love her. Rahadin assumed that Patrina would suffer the same fate as those women who had come before her. He was proven wrong when Patrina's own people stoned her to death to keep Strahd from claiming her as his wife.

Strahd was upset that the dusk elves had taken Patrina from him. After securing her body and entombing it in the catacombs of Ravenloft, Strahd sent Rahadin to punish the dusk elves. Rahadin slew the female elves so that the males couldn't breed. He also sliced off the ears of Patrina's brother, Kasimir, who had orchestrated the stoning.

entries.name: Screams of the Dead
entries: So dreadful a creature is Rahadin that anyone who stands within 10 feet of him can hear the howling screams of the countless men and women he has killed in his lifetime. Rahadin can't hear them, nor would he be haunted by them if he could. The only thing he cares about is Strahd von Zarovich, for whom he would gladly give his life.

entries.name: Ideal
entries: "Loyalty is everything."

entries.name: Bond
entries: "I am a son of King Barov von Zarovich, and I will serve his son - my brother and lord - forever."

entries.name: Flaw
entries: "I have slain thousands of men. I will slaughter thousands more to preserve the von Zarovich legacy."

monster.name: Volenta Popofsky
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance.} The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} The vampire takes 20 acid damage when it ends its turn in running water.
{@i Stake to the Heart.} The vampire is destroyed if a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into its heart while it is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h} {@damage 2d6 + 7} piercing damage plus {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h} {@damage 3d4 + 7} slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 18}).

monster.name: Anastrasya Karelova
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance.} The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} The vampire takes 20 acid damage when it ends its turn in running water.
{@i Stake to the Heart.} The vampire is destroyed if a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into its heart while it is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h} {@damage 2d6 + 4} piercing damage plus {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d4 + 3}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 14}).

action.name: Charm
entries: Anastrasya targets one humanoid she can see within 30 feet of it. It  must succeed on a {@dc 17} wisdom saving throw save or be {@condition charmed} by her. The {@condition charmed} target regards Anastrasya as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected.

action.name: Children of the Night (1/Day)
entries: Anastrasya summons either {@dice 2d4} {@creature swarm of rats|MM|rat swarms} or {@creature swarm of bats|MM|bat swarrms}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The vampire's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18} to hit {@hit 9}) . It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the vampire can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the vampire has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If Escher fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h} {@damage 3d6 + 4} piercing damage plus {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} {@damage 3d8 + 4} bludgeoning damage. The vampire can also grapple the target (escape {@dc 15}) if it is a creature and the vampire has a hand free.

action.name: Mind Siphon {@recharge 5}
entries: The vampire targets a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw, with disadvantage if the vampire has previously consumed the target's blood. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 16d6} psychic damage, and the vampire discerns the target's surface emotions and thoughts. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and the vampire discerns the target's general emotional state but not its thoughts.
